action.action-desc: Ms. Dexter introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to expand eligibility for homelessness benefits under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Every Veteran Housed Act.

section.header: Expansion of eligibility for homelessness benefits under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Section 2002 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:

paragraph.text: The term veteran includes a person who was discharged or released from a period of service as a member of the uniformed services—

clause.text: by reason of the sentence of a general court-martial; and
the length of such period of service;
whether such member was a member of an active or reserve component of the uniformed services;
whether such service was active duty;
whether such person currently serves as a member of the uniformed services; and
whether such person was discharged or released from another period of service under conditions described in clause (i) or (ii) of subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The term uniformed services has the meaning given such term in section 101 of title 10.

paragraph.header: Certain service deemed to be active service
paragraph.text: Section 106(b) of such title is amended, in the matter following paragraph (3), by inserting 20, after 19,.
Section 5303A(b)(3)(F) of such title is amended by striking section 2011, 2012, 2013, 2044, or 2061 and inserting chapter 20.
